rationale: Dose changed to 220 mcg with same 2-puff BID sig, but prior 110 mcg reference and voucher plan not documented.
Lists hoarseness, white patches, sore throat and rinse/spit instruction, but omits advising patient to call if these occur.
Clearly instructs to keep albuterol on hand and limit total to 4–6 puffs/24 h.
No mention of nighttime cough, scratchy throat, spacer use, inconsistent rinsing, or 8 puffs use last night.
Travel plans, in-flight flare concern, and nebulizer vs inhaler question entirely absent.
Assessment section not present; mild persistent asthma diagnosis not stated.
Does not import irrelevant chart data and correctly updates fluticasone strength, so no penalty issues noted.
No fabricated orders or recommendations detected.
Captures main medication changes and some counseling, but misses several key history elements, travel concern, and diagnosis, so overall completeness is moderate.
